013package org.apache.juneau.serializer;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
017
018import java.io.*;
019import java.lang.annotation.*;
020import java.util.*;
021import java.util.function.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.soap.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;
029
030/**
031 * Parent class for all Juneau serializers.
032 *
033 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
034 * <p>
035 * Base serializer class that serves as the parent class for all serializers.
036 *
037 * <p>
038 * The purpose of this class is:
039 * <ul>
040 *    <li>Maintain a read-only configuration state of a serializer.
041 *    <li>Create session objects used for serializing POJOs (i.e. {@link SerializerSession}).
042 *    <li>Provide convenience methods for serializing POJOs without having to construct session objects.
043 * </ul>
044 *
045 * <p>
046 * Subclasses should (but are not required to) extend directly from {@link OutputStreamSerializer} or {@link WriterSerializer} depending on
047 * whether it's a stream or character based serializer.
048 *
049 * <p>
050 * Subclasses must implement parsing via one of the following methods:
051 * <ul class='javatree'>
052 *    <li class='jmp'>{@link #doSerialize(SerializerSession, SerializerPipe, Object)}
053 *    <li class='jmp'>{@link SerializerSession#doSerialize(SerializerPipe, Object)}
054 * </ul>
055 * <br>
056 *
057 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
058 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
059 * </ul>
060 *
061 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
062 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/SerializersAndParsers">Serializers and Parsers</a>
063
064 * </ul>
065 */
066public class Serializer extends BeanTraverseContext {
067
068   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
069   // Static
070   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
071
072   /**
073    * Creates a new builder for this object.
074    *
075    * @return A new builder.
076    */
077   public static Builder create() {
078      return new Builder();
079   }
080
081   /**
082    * Represents no Serializer.
083    */
084   public static abstract class Null extends Serializer {
085      private Null(Builder builder) {
086         super(builder);
087      }
088   }
089
090   /**
091    * Instantiates a builder of the specified serializer class.
092    *
093    * <p>
094    * Looks for a public static method called <c>create</c> that returns an object that can be passed into a public
095    * or protected constructor of the class.
096    *
097    * @param c The builder to create.
098    * @return A new builder.
099    */
100   public static Builder createSerializerBuilder(Class<? extends Serializer> c) {
101      return (Builder)Context.createBuilder(c);
102   }
103
104   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
105   // Builder
106   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
107
108   /**
109    * Builder class.
110    */
111   @FluentSetters
112   public static class Builder extends BeanTraverseContext.Builder {
113
114      boolean addBeanTypes, addRootType, keepNullProperties, sortCollections, sortMaps, trimEmptyCollections,
115         trimEmptyMaps, trimStrings;
116      String produces, accept;
117      UriContext uriContext;
118      UriRelativity uriRelativity;
119      UriResolution uriResolution;
120      Class<? extends SerializerListener> listener;
121
122      /**
123       * Constructor, default settings.
124       */
125      protected Builder() {
126         produces = null;
127         accept = null;
128         addBeanTypes = env("Serializer.addBeanTypes", false);
129         addRootType = env("Serializer.addRootType", false);
130         keepNullProperties = env("Serializer.keepNullProperties", false);
131         sortCollections = env("Serializer.sortCollections", false);
132         sortMaps = env("Serializer.sortMaps", false);
133         trimEmptyCollections = env("Serializer.trimEmptyCollections", false);
134         trimEmptyMaps = env("Serializer.trimEmptyMaps", false);
135         trimStrings = env("Serializer.trimStrings", false);
136         uriContext = UriContext.DEFAULT;
137         uriRelativity = UriRelativity.RESOURCE;
138         uriResolution = UriResolution.NONE;
139         listener = null;
140      }
141
142      /**
143       * Copy constructor.
144       *
145       * @param copyFrom The bean to copy from.
146       */
147      protected Builder(Serializer copyFrom) {
148         super(copyFrom);
149         produces = copyFrom.produces;
150         accept = copyFrom.accept;
151         addBeanTypes = copyFrom.addBeanTypes;
152         addRootType = copyFrom.addRootType;
153         keepNullProperties = copyFrom.keepNullProperties;
154         sortCollections = copyFrom.sortCollections;
155         sortMaps = copyFrom.sortMaps;
156         trimEmptyCollections = copyFrom.trimEmptyCollections;
157         trimEmptyMaps = copyFrom.trimEmptyMaps;
158         trimStrings = copyFrom.trimStrings;
159         uriContext = copyFrom.uriContext;
160         uriRelativity = copyFrom.uriRelativity;
161         uriResolution = copyFrom.uriResolution;
162         listener = copyFrom.listener;
163      }
164
165      /**
166       * Copy constructor.
167       *
168       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy from.
169       */
170      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
171         super(copyFrom);
172         produces = copyFrom.produces;
173         accept = copyFrom.accept;
174         addBeanTypes = copyFrom.addBeanTypes;
175         addRootType = copyFrom.addRootType;
176         keepNullProperties = copyFrom.keepNullProperties;
177         sortCollections = copyFrom.sortCollections;
178         sortMaps = copyFrom.sortMaps;
179         trimEmptyCollections = copyFrom.trimEmptyCollections;
180         trimEmptyMaps = copyFrom.trimEmptyMaps;
181         trimStrings = copyFrom.trimStrings;
182         uriContext = copyFrom.uriContext;
183         uriRelativity = copyFrom.uriRelativity;
184         uriResolution = copyFrom.uriResolution;
185         listener = copyFrom.listener;
186      }
187
188      @Override /* Context.Builder */
189      public Builder copy() {
190         return new Builder(this);
191      }
192
193      @Override /* Context.Builder */
194      public Serializer build() {
195         return build(Serializer.class);
196      }
197
198      @Override /* Context.Builder */
199      public HashKey hashKey() {
200         return HashKey.of(
201            super.hashKey(),
202            produces,
203            accept,
204            addBeanTypes,
205            addRootType,
206            keepNullProperties,
207            sortCollections,
208            sortMaps,
209            trimEmptyCollections,
210            trimEmptyMaps,
211            trimStrings,
212            uriContext,
213            uriRelativity,
214            uriResolution,
215            listener
216         );
217      }
218
219      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
220      // Properties
221      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
222
223      /**
224       * Specifies the media type that this serializer produces.
225       *
226       * @param value The value for this setting.
227       * @return This object.
228       */
229      @FluentSetter
230      public Builder produces(String value) {
231         this.produces = value;
232         return this;
233      }
234
235      /**
236       * Returns the current value for the 'produces' property.
237       *
238       * @return The current value for the 'produces' property.
239       */
240      public String getProduces() {
241         return produces;
242      }
243
244      /**
245       *    Specifies the accept media types that the serializer can handle.
246       *
247       *    <p>
248       *    Can contain meta-characters per the <c>media-type</c> specification of <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html">RFC2616/14.1</a>
249       *    <p>
250       *    If empty, then assumes the only media type supported is <c>produces</c>.
251       *    <p>
252       *    For example, if this serializer produces <js>"application/json"</js> but should handle media types of
253       *    <js>"application/json"</js> and <js>"text/json"</js>, then the arguments should be:
254       *    <p class='bjava'>
255       *       <jv>builder</jv>.produces(<js>"application/json"</js>);
256       *       <jv>builder</jv>.accept(<js>"application/json,text/json"</js>);
257       *    </p>
258       * <p>
259       * The accept value can also contain q-values.
260       *
261       * @param value The value for this setting.
262       * @return This object.
263       */
264      @FluentSetter
265      public Builder accept(String value) {
266         this.accept = value;
267         return this;
268      }
269
270      /**
271       * Returns the current value for the 'accept' property.
272       *
273       * @return The current value for the 'accept' property.
274       */
275      public String getAccept() {
276         return accept;
277      }
278
279      /**
280       * Add <js>"_type"</js> properties when needed.
281       *
282       * <p>
283       * When enabled, <js>"_type"</js> properties will be added to beans if their type cannot be inferred
284       * through reflection.
285       *
286       * <p>
287       * This is used to recreate the correct objects during parsing if the object types cannot be inferred.
288       * <br>For example, when serializing a <c>Map&lt;String,Object&gt;</c> field where the bean class cannot be determined from
289       * the type of the values.
290       *
291       * <p>
292       * Note the differences between the following settings:
293       * <ul class='javatree'>
294       *    <li class='jf'>{@link #addRootType()} - Affects whether <js>'_type'</js> is added to root node.
295       *    <li class='jf'>{@link #addBeanTypes()} - Affects whether <js>'_type'</js> is added to any nodes.
296       * </ul>
297       *
298       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
299       * <p class='bjava'>
300       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that adds _type to nodes.</jc>
301       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
302       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
303       *       .addBeanTypes()
304       *       .build();
305       *
306       *    <jc>// Our map of beans to serialize.</jc>
307       *    <ja>@Bean</ja>(typeName=<js>"mybean"</js>)
308       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
309       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf> = <js>"bar"</js>;
310       *    }
311       *    JsonMap <jv>myMap</jv> = JsonMap.of(<js>"foo"</js>, <jk>new</jk> MyBean());
312       *
313       *    <jc>// Will contain:  {"foo":{"_type":"mybean","foo":"bar"}}</jc>
314       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jv>myMap</jv>);
315       * </p>
316       *
317       * @return This object.
318       */
319      @FluentSetter
320      public Builder addBeanTypes() {
321         return addBeanTypes(true);
322      }
323
324      /**
325       * Same as {@link #addBeanTypes()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
326       *
327       * @param value The value for this setting.
328       * @return This object.
329       */
330      @FluentSetter
331      public Builder addBeanTypes(boolean value) {
332         addBeanTypes = value;
333         return this;
334      }
335
336      /**
337       * Add type attribute to root nodes.
338       *
339       * <p>
340       * When enabled, <js>"_type"</js> properties will be added to top-level beans.
341       *
342       * <p>
343       * When disabled, it is assumed that the parser knows the exact Java POJO type being parsed, and therefore top-level
344       * type information that might normally be included to determine the data type will not be serialized.
345       *
346       * <p>
347       * For example, when serializing a top-level POJO with a {@link Bean#typeName() @Bean(typeName)} value, a
348       * <js>'_type'</js> attribute will only be added when this setting is enabled.
349       *
350       * <p>
351       * Note the differences between the following settings:
352       * <ul class='javatree'>
353       *    <li class='jf'>{@link #addRootType()} - Affects whether <js>'_type'</js> is added to root node.
354       *    <li class='jf'>{@link #addBeanTypes()} - Affects whether <js>'_type'</js> is added to any nodes.
355       * </ul>
356       *
357       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
358       * <p class='bjava'>
359       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that adds _type to root node.</jc>
360       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv>= JsonSerializer
361       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
362       *       .addRootType()
363       *       .build();
364       *
365       *    <jc>// Our bean to serialize.</jc>
366       *    <ja>@Bean</ja>(typeName=<js>"mybean"</js>)
367       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
368       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf> = <js>"bar"</js>;
369       *    }
370       *
371       *    <jc>// Will contain:  {"_type":"mybean","foo":"bar"}</jc>
372       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
373       * </p>
374       *
375       * @return This object.
376       */
377      @FluentSetter
378      public Builder addRootType() {
379         return addRootType(true);
380      }
381
382      /**
383       * Same as {@link #addRootType()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
384       *
385       * @param value The value for this setting.
386       * @return This object.
387       */
388      @FluentSetter
389      public Builder addRootType(boolean value) {
390         addRootType = value;
391         return this;
392      }
393
394      /**
395       * Don't trim null bean property values.
396       *
397       * <p>
398       * When enabled, null bean values will be serialized to the output.
399       *
400       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
401       *    <li class='note'>Not enabling this setting will cause <c>Map</c>s with <jk>null</jk> values to be lost during parsing.
402       * </ul>
403       *
404       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
405       * <p class='bjava'>
406       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that serializes null properties.</jc>
407       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
408       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
409       *       .keepNullProperties()
410       *       .build();
411       *
412       *    <jc>// Our bean to serialize.</jc>
413       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
414       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf> = <jk>null</jk>;
415       *    }
416       *
417       *    <jc>// Will contain "{foo:null}".</jc>
418       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
419       * </p>
420       *
421       * @return This object.
422       */
423      @FluentSetter
424      public Builder keepNullProperties() {
425         return keepNullProperties(true);
426      }
427
428      /**
429       * Same as {@link #keepNullProperties()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
430       *
431       * @param value The value for this setting.
432       * @return This object.
433       */
434      @FluentSetter
435      public Builder keepNullProperties(boolean value) {
436         keepNullProperties = value;
437         return this;
438      }
439
440      /**
441       * Serializer listener.
442       *
443       * <p>
444       * Class used to listen for errors and warnings that occur during serialization.
445       *
446       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
447       * <p class='bjava'>
448       *    <jc>// Define our serializer listener.</jc>
449       *    <jc>// Simply captures all errors.</jc>
450       *    <jk>public class</jk> MySerializerListener <jk>extends</jk> SerializerListener {
451       *
452       *       <jc>// A simple property to store our events.</jc>
453       *       <jk>public</jk> List&lt;String&gt; <jf>events</jf> = <jk>new</jk> LinkedList&lt;&gt;();
454       *
455       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
456       *       <jk>public</jk> &lt;T&gt; <jk>void</jk> onError(SerializerSession <jv>session</jv>, Throwable <jv>throwable</jv>, String <jv>msg</jv>) {
457       *          <jf>events</jf>.add(<jv>session</jv>.getLastLocation() + <js>","</js> + <jv>msg</jv> + <js>","</js> + <jv>throwable</jv>);
458       *       }
459       *    }
460       *
461       *    <jc>// Create a serializer using our listener.</jc>
462       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
463       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
464       *       .listener(MySerializerListener.<jk>class</jk>)
465       *       .build();
466       *
467       *    <jc>// Create a session object.</jc>
468       *    <jc>// Needed because listeners are created per-session.</jc>
469       *    <jk>try</jk> (WriterSerializerSession <jv>session</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.createSession()) {
470       *
471       *       <jc>// Serialize a bean.</jc>
472       *       String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>session</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
473       *
474       *       <jc>// Get the listener.</jc>
475       *       MySerializerListener <jv>listener</jv> = <jv>session</jv>.getListener(MySerializerListener.<jk>class</jk>);
476       *
477       *       <jc>// Dump the results to the console.</jc>
478       *       Json5.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.println(<jv>listener</jv>.<jf>events</jf>);
479       *    }
480       * </p>
481       *
482       * @param value
483       *    The new value for this property.
484       * @return This object.
485       */
486      @FluentSetter
487      public Builder listener(Class<? extends SerializerListener> value) {
488         listener = value;
489         return this;
490      }
491
492      /**
493       * Sort arrays and collections alphabetically.
494       *
495       * <p>
496       * When enabled, copies and sorts the contents of arrays and collections before serializing them.
497       *
498       * <p>
499       * Note that this introduces a performance penalty since it requires copying the existing collection.
500       *
501       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
502       * <p class='bjava'>
503       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that sorts arrays and collections before serialization.</jc>
504       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
505       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
506       *       .sortCollections()
507       *       .build();
508       *
509       *    <jc>// An unsorted array</jc>
510       *    String[] <jv>myArray</jv> = {<js>"foo"</js>,<js>"bar"</js>,<js>"baz"</js>};
511       *
512       *    <jc>// Produces ["bar","baz","foo"]</jc>
513       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jv>myArray</jv>);
514       * </p>
515       *
516       * @return This object.
517       */
518      @FluentSetter
519      public Builder sortCollections() {
520         return sortCollections(true);
521      }
522
523      /**
524       * Same as {@link #sortCollections()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
525       *
526       * @param value The value for this setting.
527       * @return This object.
528       */
529      @FluentSetter
530      public Builder sortCollections(boolean value) {
531         sortCollections = value;
532         return this;
533      }
534
535      /**
536       * Sort maps alphabetically.
537       *
538       * <p>
539       * When enabled, copies and sorts the contents of maps by their keys before serializing them.
540       *
541       * <p>
542       * Note that this introduces a performance penalty.
543       *
544       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
545       * <p class='bjava'>
546       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that sorts maps before serialization.</jc>
547       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
548       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
549       *       .sortMaps()
550       *       .build();
551       *
552       *    <jc>// An unsorted map.</jc>
553       *    JsonMap <jv>myMap</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>,1,<js>"bar"</js>,2,<js>"baz"</js>,3);
554       *
555       *    <jc>// Produces {"bar":2,"baz":3,"foo":1}</jc>
556       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jv>myMap</jv>);
557       * </p>
558       *
559       * @return This object.
560       */
561      @FluentSetter
562      public Builder sortMaps() {
563         return sortMaps(true);
564      }
565
566      /**
567       * Same as {@link #sortMaps()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
568       *
569       * @param value The value for this setting.
570       * @return This object.
571       */
572      @FluentSetter
573      public Builder sortMaps(boolean value) {
574         sortMaps = value;
575         return this;
576      }
577
578      /**
579       * Trim empty lists and arrays.
580       *
581       * <p>
582       * When enabled, empty lists and arrays will not be serialized.
583       *
584       * <p>
585       * Note that enabling this setting has the following effects on parsing:
586       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
587       *    <li>
588       *       Map entries with empty list values will be lost.
589       *    <li>
590       *       Bean properties with empty list values will not be set.
591       * </ul>
592       *
593       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
594       * <p class='bjava'>
595       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that skips empty arrays and collections.</jc>
596       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
597       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
598       *       .trimEmptyCollections()
599       *       .build();
600       *
601       *    <jc>// A bean with a field with an empty array.</jc>
602       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
603       *       <jk>public</jk> String[] <jf>foo</jf> = {};
604       *    }
605       *
606       *    <jc>// Produces {}</jc>
607       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
608       * </p>
609       *
610       * @return This object.
611       */
612      @FluentSetter
613      public Builder trimEmptyCollections() {
614         return trimEmptyCollections(true);
615      }
616
617      /**
618       * Same as {@link #trimEmptyCollections()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
619       *
620       * @param value The value for this setting.
621       * @return This object.
622       */
623      @FluentSetter
624      public Builder trimEmptyCollections(boolean value) {
625         trimEmptyCollections = value;
626         return this;
627      }
628
629      /**
630       * Trim empty maps.
631       *
632       * <p>
633       * When enabled, empty map values will not be serialized to the output.
634       *
635       * <p>
636       * Note that enabling this setting has the following effects on parsing:
637       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
638       *    <li>
639       *       Bean properties with empty map values will not be set.
640       * </ul>
641       *
642       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
643       * <p class='bjava'>
644       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that skips empty maps.</jc>
645       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
646       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
647       *       .trimEmptyMaps()
648       *       .build();
649       *
650       *    <jc>// A bean with a field with an empty map.</jc>
651       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
652       *       <jk>public</jk> JsonMap <jf>foo</jf> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>();
653       *    }
654       *
655       *    <jc>// Produces {}</jc>
656       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
657       * </p>
658       *
659       * @return This object.
660       */
661      @FluentSetter
662      public Builder trimEmptyMaps() {
663         return trimEmptyMaps(true);
664      }
665
666      /**
667       * Same as {@link #trimEmptyMaps()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
668       *
669       * @param value The value for this setting.
670       * @return This object.
671       */
672      @FluentSetter
673      public Builder trimEmptyMaps(boolean value) {
674         trimEmptyMaps = value;
675         return this;
676      }
677
678      /**
679       * Trim strings.
680       *
681       * <p>
682       * When enabled, string values will be trimmed of whitespace using {@link String#trim()} before being serialized.
683       *
684       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
685       * <p class='bjava'>
686       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that trims strings before serialization.</jc>
687       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
688       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
689       *       .trimStrings()
690       *       .build();
691       *
692       * <jc>// A map with space-padded keys/values</jc>
693       *    JsonMap <jv>myMap</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>" foo "</js>, <js>" bar "</js>);
694       *
695       *    <jc>// Produces "{foo:'bar'}"</jc>
696       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.toString(<jv>myMap</jv>);
697       * </p>
698       *
699       * @return This object.
700       */
701      @FluentSetter
702      public Builder trimStrings() {
703         return trimStrings(true);
704      }
705
706      /**
707       * Same as {@link #trimStrings()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
708       *
709       * @param value The value for this setting.
710       * @return This object.
711       */
712      @FluentSetter
713      public Builder trimStrings(boolean value) {
714         trimStrings = value;
715         return this;
716      }
717
718      /**
719       * URI context bean.
720       *
721       * <p>
722       * Bean used for resolution of URIs to absolute or root-relative form.
723       *
724       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
725       * <p class='bjava'>
726       *    <jc>// Our URI contextual information.</jc>
727       *    String <jv>authority</jv> = <js>"http://localhost:10000"</js>;
728       *    String <jv>contextRoot</jv> = <js>"/myContext"</js>;
729       *    String <jv>servletPath</jv> = <js>"/myServlet"</js>;
730       *    String <jv>pathInfo</jv> = <js>"/foo"</js>;
731       *
732       *    <jc>// Create a UriContext object.</jc>
733       *    UriContext <jv>uriContext</jv> = <jk>new</jk> UriContext(<jv>authority</jv>, <jv>contextRoot</jv>, <jv>servletPath</jv>, <jv>pathInfo</jv>);
734       *
735       *    <jc>// Associate it with our serializer.</jc>
736       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
737       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
738       *       .uriContext(<jv>uriContext</jv>)
739       *       .uriRelativity(<jsf>RESOURCE</jsf>)  <jc>// Assume relative paths are relative to servlet.</jc>
740       *       .uriResolution(<jsf>ABSOLUTE</jsf>)  <jc>// Serialize URLs as absolute paths.</jc>
741       *       .build();
742       *
743       *    <jc>// A relative URL</jc>
744       *    URL <jv>myUrl</jv> = <jk>new</jk> URL(<js>"bar"</js>);
745       *
746       *    <jc>// Produces "http://localhost:10000/myContext/myServlet/foo/bar"</jc>
747       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.toString(<jv>myUrl</jv>);
748       * </p>
749       *
750       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
751       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/MarshallingUris">URIs</a>
752       * </ul>
753       *
754       * @param value The new value for this property.
755       * @return This object.
756       */
757      @FluentSetter
758      public Builder uriContext(UriContext value) {
759         uriContext = value;
760         return this;
761      }
762
763      /**
764       * URI relativity.
765       *
766       * <p>
767       * Defines what relative URIs are relative to when serializing any of the following:
768       * <ul>
769       *    <li>{@link java.net.URI}
770       *    <li>{@link java.net.URL}
771       *    <li>Properties and classes annotated with {@link Uri @Uri}
772       * </ul>
773       *
774       * <p>
775       * See {@link #uriContext(UriContext)} for examples.
776       *
777       * <ul class='values javatree'>
778       *    <li class='jf'>{@link org.apache.juneau.UriRelativity#RESOURCE}
779       *       - Relative URIs should be considered relative to the servlet URI.
780       *    <li class='jf'>{@link org.apache.juneau.UriRelativity#PATH_INFO}
781       *       - Relative URIs should be considered relative to the request URI.
782       * </ul>
783       *
784       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
785       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/MarshallingUris">URIs</a>
786       * </ul>
787       *
788       * @param value
789       *    The new value for this property.
790       *    <br>The default is {@link UriRelativity#RESOURCE}
791       * @return This object.
792       */
793      @FluentSetter
794      public Builder uriRelativity(UriRelativity value) {
795         uriRelativity = value;
796         return this;
797      }
798
799      /**
800       * URI resolution.
801       *
802       * <p>
803       * Defines the resolution level for URIs when serializing any of the following:
804       * <ul>
805       *    <li>{@link java.net.URI}
806       *    <li>{@link java.net.URL}
807       *    <li>Properties and classes annotated with {@link Uri @Uri}
808       * </ul>
809       *
810       * <p>
811       * See {@link #uriContext(UriContext)} for examples.
812       *
813       * <ul class='values javatree'>
814       *    <li class='jf'>{@link UriResolution#ABSOLUTE}
815       *       - Resolve to an absolute URL (e.g. <js>"http://host:port/context-root/servlet-path/path-info"</js>).
816       *    <li class='jf'>{@link UriResolution#ROOT_RELATIVE}
817       *       - Resolve to a root-relative URL (e.g. <js>"/context-root/servlet-path/path-info"</js>).
818       *    <li class='jf'>{@link UriResolution#NONE}
819       *       - Don't do any URL resolution.
820       * </ul>
821       *
822       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
823       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/MarshallingUris">URIs</a>
824       * </ul>
825       *
826       * @param value
827       *    The new value for this property.
828       *    <br>The default is {@link UriResolution#NONE}
829       * @return This object.
830       */
831      @FluentSetter
832      public Builder uriResolution(UriResolution value) {
833         uriResolution = value;
834         return this;
835      }
836
837      // <FluentSetters>

1298   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1299   // Instance
1300   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1301
1302   final String produces, accept;
1303   final boolean
1304      addBeanTypes,
1305      keepNullProperties,
1306      trimEmptyCollections,
1307      trimEmptyMaps,
1308      trimStrings,
1309      sortCollections,
1310      sortMaps,
1311      addRootType;
1312   final UriContext uriContext;
1313   final UriResolution uriResolution;
1314   final UriRelativity uriRelativity;
1315   final Class<? extends SerializerListener> listener;
1316
1317   private final MediaRanges acceptRanges;
1318   private final MediaType[] acceptMediaTypes;
1319   private final MediaType producesMediaType;
1320
1321   /**
1322    * Constructor
1323    *
1324    * @param builder The builder this object.
1325    */
1326   protected Serializer(Builder builder) {
1327      super(builder);
1328
1329      produces = builder.produces;
1330      accept = builder.accept;
1331      addBeanTypes = builder.addBeanTypes;
1332      keepNullProperties = builder.keepNullProperties;
1333      trimEmptyCollections = builder.trimEmptyCollections;
1334      trimEmptyMaps = builder.trimEmptyMaps;
1335      trimStrings = builder.trimStrings;
1336      sortCollections = builder.sortCollections;
1337      sortMaps = builder.sortMaps;
1338      addRootType = builder.addRootType;
1339      uriContext = builder.uriContext;
1340      uriResolution = builder.uriResolution;
1341      uriRelativity = builder.uriRelativity;
1342      listener = builder.listener;
1343
1344      this.producesMediaType = MediaType.of(produces);
1345      this.acceptRanges = accept != null ? MediaRanges.of(accept) : MediaRanges.of(produces);
1346      this.acceptMediaTypes = builder.accept != null ? MediaType.ofAll(splita(builder.accept)) : new MediaType[] {this.producesMediaType};
1347   }
1348
1349   @Override /* Context */
1350   public Builder copy() {
1351      return new Builder(this);
1352   }
1353
1354   @Override /* Context */
1355   public SerializerSession.Builder createSession() {
1356      return SerializerSession.create(this);
1357   }
1358
1359   @Override /* Context */
1360   public SerializerSession getSession() {
1361      return createSession().build();
1362   }
1363
1364   /**
1365    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this serializer subclasses from {@link WriterSerializer}.
1366    *
1367    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this serializer subclasses from {@link WriterSerializer}.
1368    */
1369   public boolean isWriterSerializer() {
1370      return false;
1371   }
1372
1373   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1374   // Convenience methods
1375   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1376
1377   /**
1378    * Serializes a POJO to the specified output stream or writer.
1379    *
1380    * <p>
1381    * Equivalent to calling <c>serializer.createSession().serialize(o, output);</c>
1382    *
1383    * @param o The object to serialize.
1384    * @param output
1385    *    The output object.
1386    *    <br>Character-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
1387    *    <ul>
1388    *       <li>{@link Writer}
1389    *       <li>{@link OutputStream} - Output will be written as UTF-8 encoded stream.
1390    *       <li>{@link File} - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.
1391    *       <li>{@link StringBuilder} - Output will be written to the specified string builder.
1392    *    </ul>
1393    *    <br>Stream-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
1394    *    <ul>
1395    *       <li>{@link OutputStream}
1396    *       <li>{@link File}
1397    *    </ul>
1398    * @throws SerializeException If a problem occurred trying to convert the output.
1399    * @throws IOException Thrown by the underlying stream.
1400    */
1401   public final void serialize(Object o, Object output) throws SerializeException, IOException {
1402      getSession().serialize(o, output);
1403   }
1404
1405   /**
1406    * Shortcut method for serializing objects directly to either a <c>String</c> or <code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code>
1407    * depending on the serializer type.
1408    *
1409    * @param o The object to serialize.
1410    * @return
1411    *    The serialized object.
1412    *    <br>Character-based serializers will return a <c>String</c>
1413    *    <br>Stream-based serializers will return a <code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code>
1414    * @throws SerializeException If a problem occurred trying to convert the output.
1415    */
1416   public Object serialize(Object o) throws SerializeException {
1417      return getSession().serialize(o);
1418   }
1419
1420   /**
1421    * Convenience method for serializing an object to a String.
1422    *
1423    * <p>
1424    * For writer-based serializers, this is identical to calling {@link #serialize(Object)}.
1425    * <br>For stream-based serializers, this converts the returned byte array to a string based on
1426    * the {@link OutputStreamSerializer.Builder#binaryFormat(BinaryFormat)} setting.
1427    *
1428    * @param o The object to serialize.
1429    * @return The output serialized to a string.
1430    * @throws SerializeException If a problem occurred trying to convert the output.
1431    */
1432   public final String serializeToString(Object o) throws SerializeException {
1433      return getSession().serializeToString(o);
1434   }
1435
1436   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1437   // Other methods
1438   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1439
1440   /**
1441    * Serializes a POJO to the specified pipe.
1442    *
1443    * @param session The current session.
1444    * @param pipe Where to send the output from the serializer.
1445    * @param o The object to serialize.
1446    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
1447    * @throws SerializeException Problem occurred trying to serialize object.
1448    */
1449   protected void doSerialize(SerializerSession session, SerializerPipe pipe, Object o) throws IOException, SerializeException {
1450      throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1451   }
1452
1453   /**
1454    * Optional method that specifies HTTP request headers for this serializer.
1455    *
1456    * <p>
1457    * For example, {@link SoapXmlSerializer} needs to set a <c>SOAPAction</c> header.
1458    *
1459    * <p>
1460    * This method is typically meaningless if the serializer is being used stand-alone (i.e. outside of a REST server
1461    * or client).
1462    *
1463    * @param session The current session.
1464    * @return
1465    *    The HTTP headers to set on HTTP requests.
1466    *    Never <jk>null</jk>.
1467    */
1468   public Map<String,String> getResponseHeaders(SerializerSession session) {
1469      return Collections.emptyMap();
1470   }
1471
1472   /**
1473    * Returns the media types handled based on the value of the <c>accept</c> parameter passed into the constructor.
1474    *
1475    * <p>
1476    * Note that the order of these ranges are from high to low q-value.
1477    *
1478    * @return The list of media types.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1479    */
1480   public final MediaRanges getMediaTypeRanges() {
1481      return acceptRanges;
1482   }
1483
1484   /**
1485    * Returns the first entry in the <c>accept</c> parameter passed into the constructor.
1486    *
1487    * <p>
1488    * This signifies the 'primary' media type for this serializer.
1489    *
1490    * @return The media type.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1491    */
1492   public final MediaType getPrimaryMediaType() {
1493      return acceptMediaTypes[0];
1494   }
1495
1496   /**
1497    * Performs an action on the media types handled based on the value of the <c>accept</c> parameter passed into the constructor.
1498    *
1499    * <p>
1500    * The order of the media types are the same as those in the <c>accept</c> parameter.
1501    *
1502    * @param action The action to perform on the media types.
1503    * @return This object.
1504    */
1505   public final Serializer forEachAcceptMediaType(Consumer<MediaType> action) {
1506      for (MediaType m : acceptMediaTypes)
1507         action.accept(m);
1508      return this;
1509   }
1510
1511   /**
1512    * Optional method that returns the response <c>Content-Type</c> for this serializer if it is different from
1513    * the matched media type.
1514    *
1515    * <p>
1516    * This method is specified to override the content type for this serializer.
1517    * For example, the {@link org.apache.juneau.json.Json5Serializer} class returns that it handles media type
1518    * <js>"text/json5"</js>, but returns <js>"text/json"</js> as the actual content type.
1519    * This allows clients to request specific 'flavors' of content using specialized <c>Accept</c> header values.
1520    *
1521    * <p>
1522    * This method is typically meaningless if the serializer is being used stand-alone (i.e. outside of a REST server
1523    * or client).
1524    *
1525    * @return The response content type.  If <jk>null</jk>, then the matched media type is used.
1526    */
1527   public final MediaType getResponseContentType() {
1528      return producesMediaType;
1529   }
1530
1531   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1532   // Properties
1533   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1534
1535   /**
1536    * Add <js>"_type"</js> properties when needed.
1537    *
1538    * @see Serializer.Builder#addBeanTypes()
1539    * @return
1540    *    <jk>true</jk> if <js>"_type"</js> properties added to beans if their type cannot be inferred
1541    *    through reflection.
1542    */
1543   protected boolean isAddBeanTypes() {
1544      return addBeanTypes;
1545   }
1546
1547   /**
1548    * Add type attribute to root nodes.
1549    *
1550    * @see Serializer.Builder#addRootType()
1551    * @return
1552    *    <jk>true</jk> if type property should be added to root node.
1553    */
1554   protected final boolean isAddRootType() {
1555      return addRootType;
1556   }
1557
1558   /**
1559    * Serializer listener.
1560    *
1561    * @see Serializer.Builder#listener(Class)
1562    * @return
1563    *    Class used to listen for errors and warnings that occur during serialization.
1564    */
1565   protected final Class<? extends SerializerListener> getListener() {
1566      return listener;
1567   }
1568
1569   /**
1570    * Sort arrays and collections alphabetically.
1571    *
1572    * @see Serializer.Builder#sortCollections()
1573    * @return
1574    *    <jk>true</jk> if arrays and collections are copied and sorted before serialization.
1575    */
1576   protected final boolean isSortCollections() {
1577      return sortCollections;
1578   }
1579
1580   /**
1581    * Sort maps alphabetically.
1582    *
1583    * @see Serializer.Builder#sortMaps()
1584    * @return
1585    *    <jk>true</jk> if maps are copied and sorted before serialization.
1586    */
1587   protected final boolean isSortMaps() {
1588      return sortMaps;
1589   }
1590
1591   /**
1592    * Trim empty lists and arrays.
1593    *
1594    * @see Serializer.Builder#trimEmptyCollections()
1595    * @return
1596    *    <jk>true</jk> if empty lists and arrays are not serialized to the output.
1597    */
1598   protected final boolean isTrimEmptyCollections() {
1599      return trimEmptyCollections;
1600   }
1601
1602   /**
1603    * Trim empty maps.
1604    *
1605    * @see Serializer.Builder#trimEmptyMaps()
1606    * @return
1607    *    <jk>true</jk> if empty map values are not serialized to the output.
1608    */
1609   protected final boolean isTrimEmptyMaps() {
1610      return trimEmptyMaps;
1611   }
1612
1613   /**
1614    * Don't trim null bean property values.
1615    *
1616    * @see Serializer.Builder#keepNullProperties()
1617    * @return
1618    *    <jk>true</jk> if null bean values are serialized to the output.
1619    */
1620   protected final boolean isKeepNullProperties() {
1621      return keepNullProperties;
1622   }
1623
1624   /**
1625    * Trim strings.
1626    *
1627    * @see Serializer.Builder#trimStrings()
1628    * @return
1629    *    <jk>true</jk> if string values will be trimmed of whitespace using {@link String#trim()} before being serialized.
1630    */
1631   protected final boolean isTrimStrings() {
1632      return trimStrings;
1633   }
1634
1635   /**
1636    * URI context bean.
1637    *
1638    * @see Serializer.Builder#uriContext(UriContext)
1639    * @return
1640    *    Bean used for resolution of URIs to absolute or root-relative form.
1641    */
1642   protected final UriContext getUriContext() {
1643      return uriContext;
1644   }
1645
1646   /**
1647    * URI relativity.
1648    *
1649    * @see Serializer.Builder#uriRelativity(UriRelativity)
1650    * @return
1651    *    Defines what relative URIs are relative to when serializing any of the following:
1652    */
1653   protected final UriRelativity getUriRelativity() {
1654      return uriRelativity;
1655   }
1656
1657   /**
1658    * URI resolution.
1659    *
1660    * @see Serializer.Builder#uriResolution(UriResolution)
1661    * @return
1662    *    Defines the resolution level for URIs when serializing URIs.
1663    */
1664   protected final UriResolution getUriResolution() {
1665      return uriResolution;
1666   }
1667
1668   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1669   // Other methods
1670   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1671
1672   @Override /* Context */
1673   protected JsonMap properties() {
1674      return filteredMap()
1675         .append("addBeanTypes", addBeanTypes)
1676         .append("keepNullProperties", keepNullProperties)
1677         .append("trimEmptyCollections", trimEmptyCollections)
1678         .append("trimEmptyMaps", trimEmptyMaps)
1679         .append("trimStrings", trimStrings)
1680         .append("sortCollections", sortCollections)
1681         .append("sortMaps", sortMaps)
1682         .append("addRootType", addRootType)
1683         .append("uriContext", uriContext)
1684         .append("uriResolution", uriResolution)
1685         .append("uriRelativity", uriRelativity)
1686         .append("listener", listener);
1687   }
1688}
